mainEntity.name: What is the difference between cloud and edge (cloud vs edge)?

acceptedAnswer.text: Cloud computing centralizes processing in data centers; edge computing processes data near the user or device. The cloud offers massive scalability and complex analytics, while edge minimizes latency and reduces bandwidth for real-time or privacy-sensitive workloads.

mainEntity.name: When should I choose edge over cloud?

acceptedAnswer.text: Choose edge for ultra-low-latency needs, IoT/high data-rate devices, or when privacy/regulatory requirements demand local processing. Use cloud when you need heavy batch compute, centralized analytics, or simpler operational tooling.

mainEntity.name: Can I use both (hybrid cloud and edge)?

acceptedAnswer.text: Yes. A hybrid approach is common: filter and act at the edge, then aggregate and analyze in the cloud. This gives the benefits of both cloud and edge while controlling costs and latency.

mainEntity.name: How do I decide: cloud vs edge for my app?

acceptedAnswer.text: Use a decision framework: evaluate latency requirements, data volume, privacy, processing complexity, and operational resources. If latency or bandwidth drives requirements, prefer edge; for heavy analytics and central coordination, prefer cloud.
